noun.description: A taxon comprising all or most of the plasmodial slime moulds. Now more usually called Myxomycetes.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Annals of Natural History. From scientific Latin Myxogastres, proposed as suborder name from myxo- + -gastres (taken as plural corresponding to -gaster), the group originally being classified as gasteromycetes.
